title: Texas Abortion Providers Ask Supreme Court to Reverse Ruling on Clinics
text:
04 Texas Abortion Providers Ask Supreme Court to Reverse Ruling on Clinics 
The New York Times: WASHINGTON — Abortion providers in Texas asked the Supreme Court on Wednesday to reverse an appeals court ruling that would leave the state with 10 abortion clinics, down from more than 40. Should the court agree to hear the case, as appears likely, it could issue its first major abortion ruling since 2007 before its next term ends in June.“Texas is the second-most-populous state in the nation — home to 5.4 million women of reproductive age,” the providers wrote in urging the court to hear the case. “More than 60,000 of those women choose to have an abortion each year.”
